snippet: India’s growth is slowing and uneven, it is a difficult place to do business and it is risking another generation of millions of poor people as it fails to enact market reforms.
abstract: Tyler Cowen Economic View column observes India’s slowing growth is distributed unevenly, with the greatest burden falling on the poor; warns that if the trend continues, or worsens, many millions of Indians, for another generation, will fail to rise above extreme poverty; cites a number of causes for the slowdown and cautions that the impact of inaction by the developed world will be felt on a global scale.
lead_paragraph: India’s growth is slowing and uneven, it is a difficult place to do business and it is risking another generation of millions of poor people as it fails to enact market reforms.
